column4: hey guys I have a question. I have Ubuntu installlation and another Ubuntu installation in VirtualBox. virtual installation has OpenSSH and I'm able to connect it from inside it using "ssh localhost" but I want to connect it from host machine. I couldnt find its IP or anything. any ideas?
ifconfig from inside the VM (note you'll only be able to connect from the host machine, unless you configure bridged networking)
it is okay. I'm currently using NAT.
so with NAT you can ONLY connect from the host machine
on ifconfig, I see something like 10.0.2.15
is it its local ip?
use that IP from the host
yes but it doesn't respond
i have ubuntu server on virtual
can you ping it?  have you install ssh server?
and when I say ssh 10.0.2.15 from host machine, it doesnt work
I have openssh insatlled on guest,
ssh localhost works on guest machine
can you ping it?
it couldnt ping also
hum, i'm surprised.  but you might want to ask in the #vbox channel (but i though from Host machine it would be able to access the Guest NAT, perhaps not)
I'm also asking there simultaneously
can it be about firewall? should I forward some ports?
if you have a firewall on guest - yes it could be that!
it is default ubuntu server 11.04 installation. I am not sure there exists any by default
by default, there is not active firewall
got the answer. if we're using NAT, we should not try to connect it using its IP. we should use localhost and make a port forwarding 2222->22 then ssh -p 2222 localhost
glad you got an answer!  Thanks for the heads up.
